topic.title: Tor mode set to always but zeronet still uses direct connections?
topic.body:
My tor mode is set to always and I have no errors, but when I drag the zeronet logo in the top right corner to the left, the information tells me for example:

Connected: 15
Connectable: 662
Onion: 435
Total: 663

Does this mean I'm still connecting without tor to some peers?

1566399180_17KiwHwKMhcEVfPrnwf4wfggjmrsQ.body:
> [rbtree](#comment_2_1HXwSsLvnH8Bqds9R7xugdf6Br7qWyerLk): If you're running Linux and have netstat, you can netstat -tup to see what exactly you're connected to.

So if all <pid>/python3 entries only ever point to localhost:<whichever> then I'm good?
